Description: Shoulder sherd with part of handle root of Clazomenian black figure pottery neck amphora; exterior: black figure decoration consisting of possibly satyr (only part of hair, beard and part of head remaining), to left; at right, painted black handle zone.
Curator's comments: Compare British Museum 1888,0208.76.a. The British Museum register states that the sherd came from Naukratis. The number '19' is pencilled on the sherd's interior. A findspot numbered '19' is one of the main findspots for Greek pottery at Tell Dafana, but there must also have been a findspot 19 at Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.38)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 24, pl. IX, no. 14)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 131, no. 23)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.253, no.12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.027) (Phase 1)
Acquisition notes: Acquisition details unclear in available documentation.
